intro: Navarretia filifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The species is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. Navarretia filifolia is often found in areas with cool, moist conditions and is adapted to thrive in coastal and mountainous regions.
